result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Jerome Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Maurice Jerome Jones.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of an offer but no discovery and requests another status conference.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-21-2022
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 9-19-2022 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 11/01/2022. th

Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Maurice Jerome Jones.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Thomas Harris as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Harris accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 11/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones in court with attorney Thomas James Flanagan.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant. Case adjourned for status of counsel hearing .  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones in court in person with Attorney Thomas James Flanagan who appears by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 04CF3013. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer R. Clementz.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones in court with Attorney Thomas Flanagan; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present, but was released when SPD hadn't appointed counsel. Attorney Flanagan appears as retained counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Maurice Jerome Jones in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maurice Jerome Jones appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
